sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The arraignment, tryal and examination of Mary Moders, otherwise Stedman, now Carleton, (stiled, the German Princess) at the sessions-house in the Old Bayly being brought prisoner from the Gatehouse Westminster, for having two husbands, viz. Tho. Stedman of Canterbury Shooemaker, and John Carleton of London, Gent. : who upon a full hearing was acquitted by the jury on Thursday, June 4, 1663. Carleton, Mary, 1642?-1673.
[2], 16 p.
Printed for N. Brook ..., London : 1663.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======
The arraignment, tryal and examination of Mary Moders, otherwise Stedman, now Carleton, (stiled, the German Princess) at the sessions-house in the Old Bayly being brought prisoner from the Gatehouse Westminster, for having two husbands, viz. Tho. Stedman of Canterbury Shooemaker, and John Carleton of London, Gent. : who upon a full hearing was acquitted by the jury on Thursday, June 4, 1663. Carleton, Mary, 1642?-1673.
[2], 16 p.
Printed for N. Brook ..., London : 1663.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
N. Brook
